chapter.title: Connecting to the Internet
chapter.para: The Internet is an awesome place. A massive virtual world full of information and entertainment awaits you, may still have just one question. How do I connect to the internet? The Xubuntu Operating System on your Freekbox is fully capable of browsing the web and downloading all those cat photos, and sometimes all that is required is to plug in a single cable.

section.title: Ways to Connect to the Internet
section.para: There are 4 ways to connect your Freekbox to the Internet: Dialup, Ethernet, Wifi, and Wimax.

para.para: Dialup is a very old, near obsolete technology for transmitting internet over your phone line. Computers and hardware capable of interpreting this signal are becoming few and far between, even at Free Geek. For long term stability and security we must advise that you research other internet service providers before considering dialup for your internet needs.

section.title: Ethernet
section.para: Ethernet connections are the fastest, most stable, and most secure connections you will find anywhere. They are instant to set up and can deliver blazing fast speed that no other networking interface can come close to. So what is the catch? Well, you have to plug in a wire. Once your modem or router is set up, connect your computer to it with an ethernet cable and you should be watching Youtube in seconds.
section.emphasis: What if Google did not pop up?
section.para: It is always a good idea to make sure that everything is plugged in to the right ports. Also, never underestimate the power of a reboot. Unplug both your modem and your router (if you have one), wait 10 seconds, and plug them back in. If that still does not work it might be a good idea to contact Tech Support.
